notes.text:
SINEMA Remote Connect Server Before V3.2 SP4 is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

Siemens has released a new version for SINEMA Remote Connect Server and recommends to update to the latest version.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-626856: Multiple Vulnerabilities in SINEMA Remote Connect Sever Before V3.2 SP4 - HTML Version
SSA-626856: Multiple Vulnerabilities in SINEMA Remote Connect Sever Before V3.2 SP4 - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-626856: Multiple Vulnerabilities in SINEMA Remote Connect Sever Before V3.2 SP4

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: Affected applications contain private SSL/TLS keys on the server that are not properly protected allowing any user with server access to read these keys. This could allow an authenticated attacker to impersonate the server potentially enabling man-in-the-middle, traffic decryption or unauthorized access to services that trust these certificates.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V3.2 SP4 or later version

notes.text: Affected applications do not properly validate license restrictions against the database, allowing direct modification of the system_ticketinfo table to bypass license limitations without proper enforcement checks. This could allow with database access to circumvent licensing restrictions by directly modifying database values and potentially enabling unauthorized use beyond the permitted scope.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V3.2 SP4 or later version
